title: Lieutenant Governor Duffy and Citi Announce Over 1,250 Jobs Have Been Retained and Created in Buffalo
summary: Buffalo, N.Y. - Lieutenant Governor Robert J. Duffy and representatives from Citigroup announced today that the company reached its goal to add 650 jobs over the past six years at its office complex in Amherst's CrossPoint Business Park. The Lieutenant Governor visited the complex today to meet employees and Citi officials in celebration of this accomplishment.
tag-1: Lieutenant Governor Duffy and Citi Announce Over 1,250 Jobs Have Been Retained and Created in Buffalo
tag-3: Buffalo, N.Y. – Lieutenant Governor Robert J. Duffy and representatives from Citigroup announced today that the company reached its goal to add 650 jobs over the past six years at its office complex in Amherst's CrossPoint Business Park. The Lieutenant Governor visited the complex today to meet employees and Citi officials in celebration of this accomplishment.
tag-4: In 2007, Citi accepted a $1.75 million installment-grant proposal from Empire State Development's Jobs NOW Program for the creation of 650 jobs in Western New York by 2012. The company, which began operating in Buffalo in 1976, added these jobs to a starting base of 600 employees. The site now has approximately 1,300 employees, making it eligible for the final installment of the grant.
tag-5: "Governor Cuomo has made a bigger commitment to Western New York than any governor in our state's history, and we are already starting to see the results with new jobs and investment coming back to Buffalo and the entire region," said Lt. Governor Duffy. "We are committed to creating jobs in Western New York and rebuilding the region's economy, and with today's announcement it is clear that Citigroup has contributed in a big way to this objective. Companies like Citi, who invest in and realize the potential for business in Western New York, confirm that New York truly is Open for Business."
tag-6: "Our Amherst site is a key site for Citi, especially as we continue to seek ways to improve efficiency across the company," said William Mills, CEO of North America for Citi. "Our team here is committed to Citi's strategy and is helping us deliver results for all of our stakeholders. We continue to look at ways to leverage and grow the site further."
tag-7: "We are pleased to work with New York State to bring more high-quality jobs to Western New York," said Nassir Salim, Head of Citi's Amherst Site and Director, Citi Transaction Services. "This is an attractive and cost-effective place to do business. We have well established relationships with nearby academic institutions and are impressed with the talent of the workforce here."
tag-8: Employees at Citi's Amherst site work in a variety of roles, including technology, operations, risk, finance and compliance. Most support Citi's Institutional Clients Group.
tag-9: Information about job openings at Citi is available at http://careers.citigroup.com.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
